gmd:title.gmx:Anchor: Sperm whale skin tissue samples analyzed for C and N at UC-Santa Cruz: date and location of collection from the California Current System

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: Sperm whale skin tissue samples information Dataset Description: <p>The sperm whale skin tissue came from the California Current System from 1972 to 2005.</p><p><strong>Related Reference:</strong><br />All sampling and analytical information are supplied in:&nbsp;Ruiz-Cooley RI, Koch&nbsp; PL, Fiedler PC, McCarthy MD (2014) Carbon and Nitrogen Isotopes from Top Predator Amino Acids Reveal Rapidly Shifting Ocean Biochemistry in the Outer California Current. PLoS ONE, 9(10), e110355. http://doi.org/10.1371/journal.pone.0110355.s002.</p><p><strong>Related Datasets:</strong><br /><a href="http://www.bco-dmo.org/dataset/653047">Ruiz-Cooly 2014 - sperm whale skin bulk C and N</a><br /><a href="http://www.bco-dmo.org/dataset/653106">Ruiz-Cooly 2014 - Compound-specific carbon in sperm whale skin tissue</a><br /><a href="http://www.bco-dmo.org/dataset/653061">Ruiz-Cooly 2014 - Compound-specific nitrogen in sperm whale skin tissue</a></p> Acquisition Description:

gmd:credit.gmx:Anchor: Funding provided by NSF Division of Ocean Sciences (NSF OCE) Award Number: OCE-1155728 Award URL: http://www.nsf.gov/awardsearch/showAward.do?AwardNumber=1155728

gmd:keyword.gmx:Anchor: UC-Santa Cruz labs of P. Koch and M. McCarthy

gmd:otherConstraints.gco:CharacterString: Access Constraints: none. Use Constraints: Please follow guidelines at: http://www.bco-dmo.org/terms-use Distribution liability: Under no circumstances shall BCO-DMO be liable for any direct, incidental, special, consequential, indirect, or punitive damages that result from the use of, or the inability to use, the materials in this data submission. If you are dissatisfied with any materials in this data submission your sole and exclusive remedy is to discontinue use.

gmd:title.gmx:Anchor: A novel approach for evaluating temporal and spatial changes in trophic structure of the mesopelagic eastern Pacific

gmd:name.gmx:Anchor: A novel approach for evaluating temporal and spatial changes in trophic structure of the mesopelagic eastern Pacific

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Description from NSF award abstract:Anthropogenic and natural climatic perturbations drive changes in population dynamics of species, the structure and function of food webs, and biogeochemical processes. The PIs propose a comparative analysis of three major ecosystems to investigate temporal change in the structure of mesopelagic food webs.The PIs will investigate temporal changes in the structure of mesopelagic food webs in three major ecosystems: the California Current, Eastern Tropical Pacific, and the Peru-Humboldt Current over the past 50 years using a globally distributed apex predator as an indicator species. The predator is the sperm whale, Physeter macrocephalus, and the PIs will use stable isotope ratios of carbon and nitrogen as indicators of habitat and diet. Isotope values from bulk tissues of teeth and skin (C and N) as well as specific amino acids (N) will be used to address two primary objectives: (a) examine temporal patterns in the trophic position of sperm whales (as an indicator of changes in mesopelagic trophic structure) and baseline isotopic values (as indicators of nutrient cycling); and (b) use isotopic values, which vary among systems, to define the population structure of sperm whales from past and present times, and connectivity among populations.This project will be conducted by researchers from academia and NOAA/NMFS with expertise in stable isotope analysis, trophic ecology, and ecosystem-based management of protected species. As such, it represents an opportunity for collaboration between scientists with complementary skills and from diverse institutions to compare structure and function of ecosystems across the eastern Pacific. Moreover, it represents a collaboration between academia and a federal agency with research and management responsibilities. The project will support a postdoctoral scholar (Iliana Ruiz-Cooley), a Ph.D. student, and undergraduate students to enhance their career and collaborative opportunities. The PIs anticipate that the results of their study will provide unique data to evaluate the effects of perturbations within and among mesopelagic ecosystems. This information may allow the scientific community to relate trends in climate to changes in trophic position of top predators and nutrient cycling, allowing more robust understanding of possible responses to future warming. Finally, as the first systematic applications of compound-specific stable isotope analysis to marine mammals, the project should be highly instructive for future evaluations of the feeding ecology, population structure and dynamics of endangered marine mammals. As such, this novel approach and unique historic perspective will be directly applicable for stock assessment and management.
UC-Santa Cruz labs of P. Koch and M. McCarthy

gmd:otherCitationDetails.gco:CharacterString: http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/653139.rdf Name: SWFSC_id Units: unitless Description: identification number assigned to sample at Southwest Fisheries Science Center http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/653140.rdf Name: UCSC_id Units: unitless Description: identification number assigned to sample at UC Santa Cruz http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/653141.rdf Name: tissue Units: unitless Description: type of tissue sample http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/653142.rdf Name: preservation Units: unitless Description: how the sample was stored; either by dimethyl sulfide (DMSO) or freezing http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/653143.rdf Name: sex Units: unitless Description: sex of animal: F=female; M=male; U=unknown http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/653144.rdf Name: source Units: unitless Description: how the sample was collected (either from stranded animals or by biopsy) and where the sample was archived http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/653145.rdf Name: date_collected Units: year; month Description: date sample was collected; format: yyyy-mm http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/653146.rdf Name: site_collected Units: unitless Description: location of sample collection http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/653147.rdf Name: lat Units: decimal degrees Description: latitude; north is positive http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/653148.rdf Name: lon Units: decimal degrees Description: longitude; east is positive

gmd:otherCitationDetails.gco:CharacterString: http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P02/current/ACYC/ Name: Reference numbers Description: Data record, event, sample or measurement reference numbers http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P02/current/ACYC/ Name: Reference numbers Description: Data record, event, sample or measurement reference numbers http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P01/current/ADATAA01/ Name: Date (UT as yyyymmdd) Description: Unavailable http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P09/current/LATX/ Name: LATITUDE Description: The angular distance north or south from the equator, measured along the meridian of the point of interest. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P09/current/LONX/ Name: LONGITUDE Description: The angular distance east or west east or west of Greenwich to the point of interest.

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: identification number assigned to sample at Southwest Fisheries Science Center; General Description: unique sample identification or number; any combination of alpha numeric characters; precise definition is file dependent NERC Description: Data record, event, sample or measurement reference numbers

PI-supplied Description: identification number assigned to sample at UC Santa Cruz; General Description: unique sample identification or number; any combination of alpha numeric characters; precise definition is file dependent NERC Description: Data record, event, sample or measurement reference numbers
PI-supplied Description: type of tissue sample; General Description: text description of type of sample collected (rock, bio, fluid, etc)
PI-supplied Description: how the sample was stored; either by dimethyl sulfide (DMSO) or freezing; General Description: association with a community-wide standard parameter is not yet defined

PI-supplied Description: sex of animal: F=female; M=male; U=unknown; General Description: classification by sex (male/female), reported in a varity of codes and free text, reporting is specific to the data set in which it appears
PI-supplied Description: how the sample was collected (either from stranded animals or by biopsy) and where the sample was archived; General Description: text description of sample collected

PI-supplied Description: date sample was collected; format: yyyy-mm; General Description: date; generally reported in GMT as YYYYMMDD (year; month; day); also as MMDD (month; day); EqPac dates are local Hawaii time NERC Description: Unavailable
PI-supplied Description: location of sample collection; General Description: Sampling site identification.

PI-supplied Description: latitude; north is positive; General Description: latitude, in decimal degrees, North is positive, negative denotes South; Reported in some datasets as degrees, minutes NERC Description: The angular distance north or south from the equator, measured along the meridian of the point of interest.

PI-supplied Description: longitude; east is positive; General Description: longitude, in decimal degrees, East is positive, negative denotes West; Reported in some datsets as degrees, minutes NERC Description: The angular distance east or west east or west of Greenwich to the point of interest.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: <p><strong>BCO-DMO Processing:</strong><br />- added conventional header with dataset name, PI name, version date, reference information<br />- renamed parameters to BCO-DMO standard<br />- reformatted date from Mon-yy to yyyy-mm<br />- reformatted longitude from decimal degrees west to east<br />- replaced hyphens with nd (no data); replaced commas with semi-colons</p>

gmi:description.gco:CharacterString: PI Supplied Instrument Name: PI Supplied Instrument Description:Thermo Finnigan DeltaPlus XP isotope ratio mass spectrometer (Thermo Scientific, Bremen, Germany) Instrument Name: Isotope-ratio Mass Spectrometer Instrument Short Name:IR Mass Spec Instrument Description: The Isotope-ratio Mass Spectrometer is a particular type of mass spectrometer used to measure the relative abundance of isotopes in a given sample (e.g. VG Prism II Isotope Ratio Mass-Spectrometer). Community Standard Description: http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/L05/current/LAB16/

PI Supplied Instrument Name: Instrument Name: Gas Chromatograph Instrument Short Name:Gas Chromatograph Instrument Description: Instrument separating gases, volatile substances, or substances dissolved in a volatile solvent by transporting an inert gas through a column packed with a sorbent to a detector for assay. (from SeaDataNet, BODC) Community Standard Description: http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/L05/current/LAB02/
